theoryTitle: The Straw Hat's Connection to the Giant Frozen Hat
theoryText: Some fans theorize that Luffy's straw hat, which Whitebeard recognizes as once belonging to Shanks and originally to Gol D. Roger, is connected to the giant straw hat frozen in Mary Geoise. The giant hat may contain secrets about the Ancient Weapons, the Void Century, or serve as a key to understanding the true nature of the One Piece itself.
author: Various One Piece community members
supportingEvidence: The straw hat has been passed down from Roger to Shanks to Luffy
A giant straw hat similar in design exists in Mary Geoise
The World Government keeps the giant hat frozen in a secret chamber
Whitebeard's recognition of the hat suggests its historical significance
counterEvidence: No direct connection has been confirmed in the story
The significance may be purely symbolic rather than literal

theoryTitle: Shanks Betting on the New Age - Inherited Will Theory
theoryText: The flashback in Episode 466 where Whitebeard recalls Shanks saying he 'bet his arm on the New Age' suggests that Shanks deliberately sacrificed his arm for Luffy as part of a greater plan. Some fans theorize that Shanks knew Luffy was special (possibly the inheritor of Roger's will or the prophesied figure) and that his sacrifice was a calculated investment in the future, not just an impulsive act to save a child.
author: Various One Piece community members
supportingEvidence: Shanks is consistently portrayed as highly intelligent and strategic
He gave his straw hat (previously Roger's) to Luffy specifically
He discussed Luffy with Whitebeard before the timeskip
His exact words were 'I bet it on the New Age' not 'I lost it saving a kid'
Shanks has connections to the highest levels of the World Government
counterEvidence: Shanks appeared genuinely emotional when saving Luffy
The sacrifice could be both calculated and genuine
Some interpret it as Shanks recognizing Luffy's potential after the fact

theoryTitle: Luffy's Declaration Foreshadows His Victory Over Whitebeard's Legacy
theoryText: Luffy's bold declaration that he will surpass Whitebeard and become Pirate King is seen by some fans as foreshadowing that Luffy will eventually inherit Whitebeard's territory, allies, or influence after the war. The theory suggests that Whitebeard's acknowledgment of Luffy in this moment is a symbolic passing of the torch.
author: Various One Piece community members
supportingEvidence: Whitebeard doesn't dismiss or attack Luffy for his declaration
Several Whitebeard Pirates later ally with Luffy
Luffy eventually takes territory that was under Whitebeard's protection
counterEvidence: Luffy explicitly states he doesn't want to rule over anyone
The alliance is circumstantial, not a true inheritance
Whitebeard's legacy goes to multiple people, not just Luffy
